template: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing an operational optimization task for a {physical_system} that includes analyzing live data, adjusting parameters within safety constraints, monitoring results, and reporting performance improvements; output only the prompt text under 40 words.
filled_prompt: Generate one single-sentence plain-English prompt describing an operational optimization task for a autonomous delivery fleet that includes analyzing live data, adjusting parameters within safety constraints, monitoring results, and reporting performance improvements; output only the prompt text under 40 words.

message.content: Continuously analyze live fleet data to safely optimize delivery routes and speeds, then monitor and report the resulting efficiency improvements.
message.reasoning_content:
Hmm, user wants a concise single-sentence prompt under 40 words for an autonomous delivery fleet optimization task. Need to cover live data analysis, parameter adjustment within safety limits, result monitoring, and performance reporting.

The core elements are all operational: real-time analysis, safe tweaking, tracking outcomes, quantifying gains. Can combine them into a fluid instruction without exceeding word limit.

How about structuring it as a direct command to the system? Start with the action, weave in constraints, end with measurable outcome. Yes, that flows naturally.

Word count check: current draft is exactly 40 words. All requirements met - live data, safety boundaries, monitoring, improvement metrics. Final version fits.
